choices.E: Perform a penetration test of the competitor's network and share the results with the board
choices.D: Request information from security vendors and government agencies
choices.B: Use social media to contact industry analysts
choices.C: Use intelligence gathered from the Internet relay chat channels
choices.A: Review the CVE database for critical exploits over the past year

questions.question_text: The board of a financial services company has requested that the senior security analyst acts as a cybersecurity advisor in order to comply with recent federal legislation. The analyst is required to give a report on current cybersecurity and threat trends in the financial services industry at the next board meeting. Which of the following would be the BEST methods to prepare this report? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Holy crap, the answer is right!
The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) system provides a reference-method for publicly known information-security vulnerabilities and exposures.

comments.content:
D is right!

The most common ICMP tunneling program is LOKI. It uses the ICMP echo-response packet to carry its payload. By using LOKI, one can transmit data secretly by hiding the traffic so networking devices cannot detect the transmission.

questions.question_text: A company is concerned about disgruntled employees transferring its intellectual property data through covert channels. Which of the following tools would allow employees to write data into ICMP echo response packets?

A company contracts a security consultant to perform a remote white-box penetration test. The company wants the consultant to focus on Internet-facing services without negatively impacting production services. Which of the following is the consultant MOST likely to use to identify the company's attack surface? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
I think the given answers are correct, but just because web crawler is new to me...

"A Web crawler, sometimes called a spider or spiderbot and often shortened to crawler, is an Internet bot that systematically browses the World Wide Web and that is typically operated by search engines for the purpose of Web indexing (web spidering)."
I can't wrap my head around why a white-box test would ever need to rely on a WHOIS entry...another great Comptia question

comments.content: good point, but then, what are the answers?
IMO: given answers are probably what comptia wants. Just a dumb question.

discussion.content: This is a white-box penetration test. Wouldn't the pentester already have most, or all, of the information in the DNS and WHOIS?

questions.question_text: A company is the victim of a phishing and spear-phishing campaign. Users are clicking on website links that look like common bank sites and entering their credentials accidentally. A security engineer decides to use a layered defense to prevent the phishing or lessen its impact. Which of the following should the security engineer implement? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: It is a little difficulte to understand what is going on here. Are the users employees of the company, or customers? Do the users think they are clicking on links to banks used by the company? Or are do the users think they are clicking on links to the user's own banks? If we guess the users are clicking on links to what they think are company's bank accounts the correct controls would be spam filters, and content filters. Spam filters might help keep down the phishing emails. Content filters would keep the users from going to bogus sites.

questions.question_text: A creative services firm has a limited security budget and staff. Due to its business model, the company sends and receives a high volume of files every day through the preferred method defined by its customers. These include email, secure file transfers, and various cloud service providers. Which of the following would BEST reduce the risk of malware infection while meeting the company's resource requirements and maintaining its current workflow?

choices.D: Implement appropriate DLP systems with strict policies
choices.C: Enable customers to send and receive files via SFTP
choices.A: Configure a network-based intrusion prevention system
choices.B: Contract a cloud-based sandbox security service
